image.title: Smart Preloading
image.caption: img are pre-loaded in the background to avoid load bars when viewing an image.

image.title: Welcome to Juicebox!
image.caption: Juicebox is a free, customizable image gallery. Use it to display your img on any web page in a professional, intuitive and simple way.
image.title: Universal Playback
image.caption: Juicebox can be viewed on Windows, Mac, Linux, iPhone, iPad and Android. It works on all modern browsers all the way back to Internet Explorer 6.
image.title: JuiceboxBuilder
image.caption: Easily create Juicebox galleries using JuiceboxBuilder, our free desktop app.
image.title: Features
image.caption: Juicebox features intuitive image navigation, smart image pre-loading and a resizable interface that scales to fit the browser window (try resizing your browser).
image.title: Toggle Overlay
image.caption: To hide image overlay on a touch device, tap the screen. On a mouse device, move the mouse ourtside the gallery.
Handles img with different aspect ratios. img can be tall or wide.
img can be loaded via an XML document or directly from Flickr using a Flickr user name and/or tags.
image.title: Easy Navigation
image.caption: Navigate through the img by clicking or using the keyboard: Cursor keys and Home, End Keys. On a touch device, swipe to view the next image.
image.title: Button Bar
image.caption: Supports optional Toggle Thumbnails, Expand Gallery and Open Image buttons in the the Button Bar at top-right.
image.title: Customizable
image.caption: Modify look and feel by setting configuration options. View available config options.
image.title: Image Titles and Captions
image.caption: Each image can have an optional title and a caption. Supports non-english characters: ンツを活用して広告収入を得ることが可能

Captions can be HTML formatted. Supported tags are bold, underline, italics, hyperlinks, linebreaks
and font tags
image.title: Juicebox-Pro
image.caption: For advanced customization options, no branding and more - upgrade to Juicebox-Pro.
image.title: Thanks!
image.caption: Gallery img kindly provided by John Carey of Fifty Foot Shadows.
